January 22, 1923
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
For over two years the International Health
Board has been publishing quarterly for distribution
to its staff a Bulletin which in the beginning was
made up primarily of news items and other matter of
little or no interest to anyone outside of the Board's
own personnel. During the past year, however, the
character of the Bulletin has changed to some extent,
the personal and staff news having been largely dis-
placed by reports and discussion dealing with the
scientific and administrative aspects of the work in
which the Board is engaged.

The Bulletin is still published primarily
for the information of our staff, but it occurs to us
that in its present form it may also be of interest
to a few health workers who, although not actually
members of the staff, are or have been associated in
some way with the activities of the Board. Accordingly,
we are sending you the January, 1923, issue and shall
be glad to continue to send it to you if you find it of
interest.

We have no thought of making of the Bulletin
a journal for general distribution or adding materially
to the present mailing list. Will you, therefore,
kindly keep in mind that the Bulletin is sent to you for
your personal information and should not be quoted or
referred to in ways which might call for a distribution
that would be inconsistent with its character as the
staff organ of the Board.
